panel.name: body
panel.component:
Content Window

Located within the Page Editor

The Content Window is used to manage each content layer along with the components that are loaded within each content layer.

The icon located on the Page Editor toolbar's content button is a faded ring with three faded lines and one blue line. The faded ring represents the page, while the faded lines represents all the content layers within the page and the blue line represents a single content layer.

Content Layers

The page content layer is used to add content to the current page. All other content layers loaded on the page are created independantly and can be loaded onto any web page. This allows content to be shared across multiple pages.

Selected Content Layer

Any components that you drag & drop onto the page will be loaded into the currently selected content layer. By default, the page content layer is selected, so if you'd like to add components to other content layers, you must select a content layer from the drop down arrow within the toolbar's content button, or from the content window.

1|3|title[Create a new Content Layer[description[Click this button to create a new content layer that can be used to add components to. Afterwards, you can load your new content layer onto other pages as well.[photo[vttmjaugqt.png|title[Load an existing Content Layer[description[Click this button to load an existing content layer onto your page, and with it all of the components associated with that content layer. If you wish to manipulate any of the components that belong to a content layer, it will affect all pages that use the same content layer.[photo[nrnjekrbtw.png|title[Copy Content from a Page[description[Click this button to select a page to copy all the content from. This is useful for building pages that have very similar content is subtle changes.[photo[pxqenysvyk.png
